title: Lajatang
data:
***Version [0.31](/0.31 "0.31")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

| Name                                           | Lajatang                   |
| :--------------------------------------------- | -------------------------- |
| Skill                                          | [Staves](/Staves "Staves") |
| [Damage](/Weapon_damage "Weapon damage")       | 16                         |
| Accuracy                                       | -3                         |
| [Base delay](/Weapon_speed "Weapon speed") (%) | 14 (140%)                  |
| [Min delay](/Minimum_delay "Minimum delay")    | 7 at skill 14              |
| [Hands](/Handedness "Handedness")              | 2H                         |
| Size                                           | Large                      |
| Ranged?                                        | No                         |

|   |                                                                                                  |
| - | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
|   | A very rare and extremely effective weapon, featuring a pole with half-moon blades at both ends. |

> This weapon falls into the '[Staves](/Staves "Staves")' category. It is a two handed weapon.

**Lajatangs** are the most powerful staves, as far as melee combat is concerned. For their damage output, lajatangs have a remarkably low base delay, meaning they require less skill to use effectively.

As chopping weapons, lajatangs will cut off [hydra](/Hydra "Hydra") heads. As Staves, lajatangs may generate with the [speed brand](/Speed_brand "Speed brand").

## Strategy

At [minimum delay](/Minimum_delay "Minimum delay"), lajatangs are worse than comparable options like [great maces](/Great_mace "Great mace") or [great swords](/Great_sword "Great sword"). However, lajatangs require much less skill than competitors - 14 rather than 20 skill. And if you were already using a [quarterstaff](/Quarterstaff "Quarterstaff"), you might as well use a lajatang (if you find one).

True to its description, lajatangs are rare. [Agnes](/Agnes "Agnes") always carries a lajatang. You can occasionally find lajatangs on [spriggan defenders](/Spriggan_defender "Spriggan defender").

html:
Lajatang

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.31: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.
Name Lajatang
Skill Staves
Damage 16
Accuracy -3
Base delay (%) 14 (140%)
Min delay 7 at skill 14
Hands 2H
Size Large
Ranged? No
A very rare and extremely effective weapon, featuring a pole with half-moon blades at both ends.
This weapon falls into the 'Staves' category. It is a two handed weapon.

Lajatangs are the most powerful staves, as far as melee combat is concerned. For their damage output, lajatangs have a remarkably low base delay, meaning they require less skill to use effectively.

As chopping weapons, lajatangs will cut off hydra heads. As Staves, lajatangs may generate with the speed brand.

Strategy

At minimum delay, lajatangs are worse than comparable options like great maces or great swords. However, lajatangs require much less skill than competitors - 14 rather than 20 skill. And if you were already using a quarterstaff, you might as well use a lajatang (if you find one).

True to its description, lajatangs are rare. Agnes always carries a lajatang. You can occasionally find lajatangs on spriggan defenders.

Image
Mundane
Magical
Artifact
Unrandart

Maces & Flails Club • Demon whip • Dire flail • Eveningstar • Flail • Giant club • Giant spiked club • Great mace • Mace (Hammer) • Morningstar • Sacred scourge • Whip

Polearms Bardiche • Demon trident • Glaive • Halberd (Scythe) • Spear • Trident • Trishula
Ranged Weapons Arbalest • Hand cannon • Longbow • Orcbow • Shortbow • Sling • Triple crossbow

Staves Lajatang • Magical staff • Quarterstaff
